Description: (NF1) - A disease characterized by patches of skin pigmentation (cafe-au-lait spots), Lisch nodules of the iris, tumors in the peripheral nervous system and fibromatous skin tumors. Individuals with the disorder have increased susceptibility to the development of benign and malignant tumors.

(NF2) - Genetic disorder characterized by bilateral vestibular schwannomas (formerly called acoustic neuromas), schwannomas of other cranial and peripheral nerves, meningiomas, and ependymomas. It is inherited in an autosomal dominant fashion with full penetrance.
A rare genetic disorder characterized by the presence of multiple schwannomas.
An NF diagnosis (e.g. NF1, NF2, or Schwannomatosis) does not apply here.
